snippet: Justin Welby, chosen to lead the world’s 77 million Anglicans, signaled a middle course on same-sex marriage and the ordination of women as bishops.
abstract: Bishop Justin Welby, new archbishop of Canterbury and spiritual head of world’s estimated 77 million Anglicans, pledges to seek reconciliation in some of the most contentious issues of gender and sexuality that have split the Anglican Communion.
lead_paragraph: Justin Welby, chosen to lead the world’s 77 million Anglicans, signaled a middle course on same-sex marriage and the ordination of women as bishops.

headline.seo: Justin Welby Appointed Archbishop of Canterbury
headline.main: Anglican Church’s New Leader Vows to Seek Reconciliation
headline.print_headline: Anglican Church’s New Leader Vows to Seek Reconciliation

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
